lessonTitle: Introduction to Noun Cases: Nominative, Dative, Genitive

exercises.title: Case Recognition
exercises.instructions: Identify which case is being used in each sentence.

questions.question: In the sentence 'კატა ხედავს' (kat'a khedavs - The cat sees), what case is კატა (kat'a)?
questions.explanation: კატა (kat'a) is in Nominative case because it is the subject of the sentence - the one doing the action (seeing).

questions.question: In the sentence 'მე ვხედავ კატას' (me vkhedav kat'as - I see the cat), what case is კატას (kat'as)?
questions.explanation: კატას (kat'as) is in Dative case because it is the direct object - receiving the action of being seen. Notice the -ს ending, which is the typical Dative marker.

questions.question: In the sentence 'ეს არის ბავშვის წიგნი' (es aris bavshvis ts'igni - This is the child's book), what case is ბავშვის (bavshvis)?
questions.explanation: ბავშვის (bavshvis) is in Genitive case because it shows possession - the book belongs to the child. Notice the -ის ending, which is the typical Genitive marker.

exercises.title: Case Transformation
exercises.instructions: Transform each noun from Nominative to Dative and Genitive forms.

questions.question: Transform წიგნი (ts'igni - book) to Dative case: _____
questions.explanation: To form Dative, add -ს to the base form: წიგნი → წიგნს (ts'igni → ts'igns)

questions.question: Transform წიგნი (ts'igni - book) to Genitive case: _____
questions.explanation: To form Genitive, replace the final vowel with -ის: წიგნი → წიგნის (ts'igni → ts'ignis)

questions.question: Transform სახლი (sakhli - house) to Dative case: _____
questions.explanation: To form Dative, add -ს to the base: სახლი → სახლს (sakhli → sakhl-s)

questions.question: Transform სახლი (sakhli - house) to Genitive case: _____
questions.explanation: To form Genitive, replace the final vowel with -ის: სახლი → სახლის (sakhli → sakhlis)

exercises.title: Match Cases to Functions
exercises.instructions: Match each case with its function in Georgian sentences.

rightItems.text: Subject of sentence (who does the action)

questions.explanation: Nominative marks the subject, Dative marks the direct/indirect object, and Genitive shows possession.

exercises.title: Complete the Sentences
exercises.instructions: Fill in the blank with the correct case form of the noun in parentheses.

questions.question: მე ვკითხულობ _____ (წიგნი - book).
questions.explanation: Use Dative case (წიგნს) because the book is the direct object of the verb 'I read'.

questions.question: ეს არის _____ (ბავშვი - child) სახლი.
questions.explanation: Use Genitive case (ბავშვის) because it shows possession - the house belongs to the child.

questions.question: _____ (კატა - cat) თამაშობს. (The cat plays)
questions.explanation: Use Nominative case (კატა) because the cat is the subject of the sentence.
